It is our belief that the future of our community, state, and nation hinges on the quality of the students being educated by our school system.","metaKeywordsSEO":"","pageTitleSEO":"Terrell ISD","pageUriSEO":"home","hidePage":false,"isMobileLandingPage":false,"underConstruction":false,"tpaApplicationId":0,"pageSecurity":{"requireLogin":false},"isPopup":false,"indexable":true,"isLandingPage":false,"pageBackgrounds":{"desktop":{"custom":true,"isPreset":true},"mobile":{"custom":true,"isPreset":true,"mediaSizing":"viewport"}},"translationData":{"uriSEOTranslated":false},"ignoreBottomBottomAnchors":true,"ogImage":""},"target":"_self"},"displayMode":"fill"},"containerId":"comp-k7ih737w","displayMode":"fill"}

p.span: Terrell ISD is working closely with local and state officials to monitor this situation surrounding

COVID-19. We will continue to provide you with the latest information about the coronavirus and any school related closures via Remind, email, Facebook, website, and phone calls. Please see the links to our frequently asked questions in both English and Spanish below.

Following the guidance from health officials and our state and national government leaders, Terrell ISD has made the determination to close all schools indefinitely. Decisions like this are not made lightly, and are made with the health, safety, and well-being of our students and staff at the forefront of our minds. The District will continue to serve our families through at-home learning avenues and provide meals to children ages 1-18 for the remainder of the closure. The District will release additional information and updates to our families as they become available. We miss you Tigers, please stay home and please stay safe.

span.span: What to do if You are Sick
How to Talk to your Children About Coronavirus
How to Talk to your Elementary Children About Coronavirus
